easy.solution: 'p.o.' means by mouth; 'q.d.' means once daily.
'b.i.d.' stands for bis in die, meaning twice daily.
't.i.d.' stands for ter in die, meaning three times daily.
'q.i.d.' stands for quater in die, meaning four times daily.
'q.h.s.' stands for quaque hora somni, meaning at bedtime.

hard.prompt: English → Latin: Apply to affected area twice daily
hard.solution: Twice daily translates to 'b.i.d.' (bis in die).

hard.prompt: English → Latin: Take one tablet by mouth four times daily
English → Latin: Instill one drop in each eye at bedtime
hard.solution: At bedtime translates to 'q.h.s.' (quaque hora somni).
answerText: Instill one drop in each eye q.h.s.

hard.prompt: English → Latin: Take two capsules by mouth every morning
hard.solution: By mouth = 'p.o.'; every morning = 'q.a.m.' (quaque ante meridiem).
